page.title: 07SHOPPING IN HULL
page.content: As part of a Geography fieldwork project, we asked 10 different people in the Whitefriargate shopping area 5 questions. The survey took place on the 6th June 1985. The five questions on the shoppers questionnaire were: What have you come into town for? Where do you live? How did you travel to the town centre? How often do you come into town? and what other shops would you like to see in Hull? We found that people came into town to shop, work or to complete money transactions. They came in from North Hull Estate, Greatfield, Bransholme, Willerby, Kirkella and one fron Leeds. They seemed to come into Hull quite often, although some visited the town less than once a month. 20% of the shoppers would like more clothes shops, 10% more Pubs, 10% more sports shops and the other 60% didn't mind.
